personal.name: Jay Shah
personal.title: Software Engineering Student
personal.intro: I'm a Computer Science student at King's College London, focused on machine learning, data-driven systems, and building reliable software. I enjoy working across the stack and on problems that reward strong quantitative reasoning.

paragraphs: Currently pursuing a BSc in Computer Science at King's College London, where I'm expected to graduate with First Class Honours in May 2026.

My journey in technology began early, starting with Python in Year 6 through Code Club. Since then, I've developed expertise across the full stack, from machine learning algorithms to user interfaces.

I'm particularly drawn to projects that combine technical complexity with real-world impact, whether that's building sentiment analysis tools for financial markets or creating data-driven applications that solve genuine problems.

highlights.title: Currently
highlights.description: Software Engineering Student at King's College London, specializing in full-stack development and machine learning applications.

highlights.title: Recent Experience
highlights.description: Software Engineering Intern at HubSpot, contributing to Data Studio and improving product reliability for thousands of customers.

highlights.title: Research & Innovation
highlights.description: Co-authored research on FinBERT applications for sentiment analysis and developed quantitative portfolio models for Deutsche Bank.

experience.title: BSc Computer Science
points: Expected First Class Honours degree in Computer Science

experience.title: A-Levels & GCSEs
points: A-Levels: Maths (A*), Further Maths (A*), Computer Science (A), Physics (A)
Junior Mathematical Olympiad (2018): Achieved Distinction and Medal, ranking in the top 200 nationally
Intermediate Mathematical Olympiad - Cayley (2019): Earned Distinction and Medal, placing in the top 100 nationally

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
points: Contributed to Data Studio, a flagship HubSpot feature launched at INBOUND 2025 and now used by thousands of customers
Engineered a smart account verification polling system, reducing recovery time after verification errors from minutes to seconds and eliminating stale verification states
Built an intelligent sync restart mechanism, reducing redundant API calls and improving sync throughput and reliability
Strengthened product reliability with expanded automated test coverage, reducing regressions and supporting production releases

experience.title: Data Administrator
points: Cleansed and validated client data for major retailers such as Aldi, Tesco, Waitrose, and Greggs, ensuring accuracy and readiness for migration to the company's new system
Automated data validation using Python, improving efficiency by up to 12 times compared to the manual approach previously used by the team

experience.title: Software Developer Intern
points: Collaborated in a team developing front-end components for Ocado Technologies
Independently designed and implemented new features using React.js
Critiqued and reviewed code solutions proposed by team members before deployment
Designed tests using the Jest framework with TypeScript to guarantee code correctness and reliability

experience.title: Software Developer Work Experience
points: Conducted research and development into the use of machine learning algorithms using TensorFlow to categorise transactions in the company's database
Automated API testing using Postman, enabling scalable and repeatable test suites for continuous integration
Developed and automated end-to-end tests using Playwright in Python, reducing manual testing time

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Used extensively for machine learning, quantitative modelling, and backend development. Built end-to-end ML systems including an LSTM stock predictor, recommendation APIs, and robotics control software. Used professionally for ML research at Armalytix and data automation at Ashbury Global. Proficient with pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, Django, and Flask.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: Frontend-focused, with experience building responsive, component-driven interfaces in React for production and personal projects, including this site, a meal planner, and a client data warehouse interface. Comfortable with modern JavaScript (ES6+), async patterns, DOM manipulation, and REST API integration.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Strong object-oriented foundations from university coursework, with projects including a visualisation tool for COVID-19 spread in London.

skills.name: C++
skills.description: Applied to algorithmic problem-solving and quantitative projects. Built solvers and optimisers (countdown solver, string construction optimiser, Sudoku-like puzzle solver) and used C++ for prototyping quantitative trading strategies at King's Capital.

skills.name: Scala
skills.description: Experience with functional programming through projects including a mini compiler, a regular expression matcher, and an implementation of the board game Shogun.

skills.name: React
skills.description: Primary frontend framework for this site and professional work at HubSpot and Valtech (Ocado Technologies). Built reusable components, managed state, and shipped production features for both client and personal projects.

skills.name: Node.js
skills.description: Built backend services and API endpoints for the Meal Planner application.

skills.name: Django
skills.description: Developed a full-stack tutoring platform and the backend for a client-facing data warehouse interface (MakCorp).

skills.name: Flask
skills.description: Over two years of experience. Preferred for lightweight APIs and deploying machine learning models.

skills.name: TensorFlow
skills.description: Used to build deep learning models, including an LSTM for time-series forecasting and transaction categorisation research at Armalytix.

projects.title: Financial Dashboard with Stock Predictor
projects.description: Built a financial analytics dashboard combining time-series modelling and sentiment analysis. Implemented an LSTM model in TensorFlow and a sentiment pipeline over financial news and social media, with a JavaScript frontend and a Flask backend.

projects.title: Meal Planner
projects.description: Developed a full-stack meal planning application using React and Node.js. Built a personalised recommendation API in Flask using clustering-based similarity models over vectorised recipes, with automated 30-day planning and shopping list generation.

projects.title: Financial Sentiment Analysis Research & Platform
projects.description: Co-authored a #research paper# exploring FinBERT applications for sentiment analysis in financial markets. Independently developed and deployed a web-based sentiment analysis tool now actively used by society members as a decision support system for investment decisions and market research.

projects.title: Quantitative Equity Portfolio Management Project - Deutsche Bank Collaboration
projects.description: Invited by the Global Head of Quantitative Investment Solutions Research at Deutsche Bank to implement strategies from Chincarini & Kim's 'Quantitative Equity Portfolio Management'. Developed and back-tested two systematic portfolio models: a market-neutral strategy eliminating market risk while maximizing alpha, and a beta-neutral strategy with strategic factor tilts to enhance returns. Presented findings to Managing Directors and VPs in Deutsche Bank's Quant team.

projects.title: Customising a client's data warehouse interface
projects.description: Built a custom data warehouse #website# from scratch using React and Django, working in a small team to deliver client-facing dashboards and backend integrations.
